title: Teen arrested after 'young child' found in water
description: Lincolnshire Police was called to a park in Lincoln on Thursday night, with an investigation launched.
content:
A teenage boy has been arrested after a "young child" was found in water at a park, police said.

Lincolnshire Police was called to Boultham Park in Lincoln at about 21:20 BST on Thursday when they discovered the child.

The child sustained minor injuries, the force said, and was taken to hospital for further checks. Officers remain at the park, with investigations taking place to determine how the child ended up in the water.

Police asked those who were in the park at the time who saw or heard anything suspicious to get in contact.

"Any detail, no matter how small, could prove crucial," a force spokesperson added.

Listen to highlights from Lincolnshire on BBC Sounds, watch the latest episode of Look North or tell us about a story you think we should be covering here.

Download the BBC News app from the App Store for iPhone and iPad or Google Play for Android devices
summary: A teenage boy has been arrested after a child was found in water at a park in Lincoln, under the influence of alcohol. The child was taken to hospital for treatment and is being investigated by the police for any suspicious activity. Police are asking for witnesses to report any suspicious behaviour.
shortSummary: A teenage boy was arrested after a child was found in a lake in Lincolnshire with minor injuries.

The official BBC News app offers you the latest live news you can trust from our UK and global network of journalists.
Download the BBC News app, where you'll get top stories and breaking news, live reporting, and the option to follow news topics that match your interests. Our topics range from UK News, Health, Lifestyle, Culture, Business, Technology and Science and Environment. These can all be found in the My News tab in the app.
The BBC News app offers the following:
News, Features & AnalysisHeadlines, detailed analysis, and exclusive features.
Breaking news and top stories Get breaking news and top stories from our trusted global network of journalists.
Live news and developing storiesFollow developing stories with up-to-the-minute reporting available 24-hours a day and access the BBC News channel live stream.
Local news and weatherUsing the UK postcode in your BBC account, we'll show you local stories and weather to stay informed on your area.
Alerts for top storiesOpt-in to push alerts where you will receive notifications instantly to your device.
Follow news that's important to you with My NewsCreate a personalised My News experience that brings together the topics and stories you care about and trust the most. Access them quickly in the My News tab.
------
If you choose to receive push alerts, a unique identifier relating to your device will be stored by Airship on behalf of the BBC to provide you with the service. No other personal data relating to you (such as a username or email address) is processed.
You can choose to unsubscribe from BBC News push notifications in your device's 'Notifications' screen.
For attribution and analysis purposes, our data processor AppsFlyer collects the below information about you:
- Your device information, such as device type
- Your IP address to determine your location
- Activity data, such as the time you downloaded the app
- Which sites (if any) referred you to download and use the app
We also use this data together with your BBC account data to improve the BBC News service. You can opt out from AppsFlyer tracking by filling out their 'Forget My Device' form:
https://www.appsflyer.com/optout.
The BBC News app uses technologies similar to cookies to measure audience behaviour. The app uses information collected through these technologies for internal purposes to analyse and improve the app and help us give you a better experience. You can switch this off using the Send App Statistics toggle on the BBC News app's Settings screen.
For more information about how and why we use information about you, please visit the BBC News App Privacy Notice:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/privacy/bbc-news-uk-app-privacy-noticeThe BBC will keep your information secure and not share it with anyone else in accordance with the BBC's Privacy Policy which can be found here:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/privacy.
For more information about how the BBC processes your personal data to provide a personalised service to you, please see the BBC's Privacy and Cookies Policy at
https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/privacy/how-does-the-bbc-collect-data-about-me/.
If you install this app, you accept the BBC Terms of Use at
http://www.bbc.co.uk/terms/.

Live, Breaking & News Analysis

What’s New
Version 7.29.1
This release contains general bug fixes and improvements.
Ratings and Reviews
Editors’ Notes
The BBC News app is about as trusted a news source as you’ll find, but what we really love is how it lets us create our own bespoke channel. Choose topics from a staggeringly comprehensive list, and suddenly you’re getting just the stories that truly matter to you. It makes the challenge of keeping up with the world almost manageable.
Go Forward or Backward
Sorry but the previous version was better than this latest revision. Now there is so much news available but not properly categorised or is out of date, you can be forgiven to miss something important. It also wastes time - reviewing old items that certainly should not appear on “My News”. It may have a categorised place though.... How about a category for “old news” or “ Updates”
To help with all of this, it would be good if at the end of each item, both in picture format or detailed text, you add the date and time the item was first broadcast. You can also add an update date / time, but keep you first broadcast date / time as well. The date / time of your informative news incidents is important to everyone so this is a very worthy consideration.
Thank you for reading and considering this.
Not all updates are improvements
I have had to downgrade this latest version 7.0.0 It’s really not doing it for me, I preferred the old version where you had swipe right to different topics, this scrolling one is terrible, and doesn’t seem to show as many topics, and fresh news is less than it was, The only thing I find I want to scroll is back to the previous Version, still I suppose these app developers have to keep themselves looking busy 2 / 5 and that’s being generous.
Update: Further downgrade to 1 Star, seems the app has a Share function, so you can share news on Facebook etc… but it doesn’t actually work, you press Share, and select Facebook, it appears to perform a curtsy and that’s it, so it is awkward to use and lacks functionality, don’t know why they did this, the previous version was much better. Pointless
Updated Update, well the latest version seems to have fixed the curtsy and I can now share news as a post on Facebook, but sadly the layout is still not improving any, but back up to 2 Stars, I wish they’d go back to the previous sideways scroll, I really can’t find any interest in the vertical scroll.
App Privacy

argos_summary: A teenage boy has been arrested after a young child was found in water at Boultham Park in Lincoln. The child suffered minor injuries and was taken to the hospital for further checks. Police are investigating the circumstances surrounding the incident and are seeking information from anyone who was in the park at the time.
